verses.esv:
4   The Spirit of God has made me,
    and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
verses.kjv: 4 The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
verses.niv: 4 The Spirit of God has made me; the breath of the Almighty gives me life.

verses.esv: 7 then the LORD God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature.
verses.kjv: 7 And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
verses.niv: 7 the LORD God formed the man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.

verses.esv:
3   as long as my breath is in me,
    and the spirit of God is in my nostrils,
verses.kjv: 3 All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
verses.niv: 3 as long as I have life within me, the breath of God in my nostrils,

verses.esv:
150:1   Praise the LORD!
  Praise God in his sanctuary;
    praise him in his mighty heavens!
2   Praise him for his mighty deeds;
    praise him according to his excellent greatness!
3   Praise him with trumpet sound;
    praise him with lute and harp!
4   Praise him with tambourine and dance;
    praise him with strings and pipe!
5   Praise him with sounding cymbals;
    praise him with loud clashing cymbals!
6   Let everything that has breath praise the LORD!
  Praise the LORD!
verses.kjv: 6 Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. Praise ye the LORD.
verses.niv: 6 Let everything that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.

verses.esv: 22 And when he had said this, he breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.kjv: 22 And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:
verses.niv: 22 And with that he breathed on them and said, "Receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.esv:
5   Thus says God, the LORD,
    who created the heavens and stretched them out,
    who spread out the earth and what comes from it,
  who gives breath to the people on it
    and spirit to those who walk in it:
verses.kjv: 5 Thus saith God the LORD, he that created the heavens, and stretched them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:
verses.niv: 5 This is what God the LORD says- he who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and all that comes out of it, who gives breath to its people, and life to those who walk on it:

verses.esv: 9 Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the breath; prophesy, son of man, and say to the breath, Thus says the Lord GOD: Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.”
verses.kjv: 9 Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.
verses.niv: 9 Then he said to me, "Prophesy to the breath; prophesy, son of man, and say to it, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe into these slain, that they may live.'"

verses.esv: 16 All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
verses.kjv: 16 All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
verses.niv: 16 All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

verses.esv:
14   If he should set his heart to it
    and gather to himself his spirit and his breath,
15   all flesh would perish together,
    and man would return to dust.
verses.kjv: 14 If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath; 15 All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
verses.niv: 14 If it were his intention and he withdrew his spirit and breath, 15 all mankind would perish together and man would return to the dust.

verses.esv: 25 nor is he served by human hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all mankind life and breath and everything.
verses.kjv: 25 Neither is worshipped with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;
verses.niv: 25 And he is not served by human hands, as if he needed anything, because he himself gives all men life and breath and everything else.

verses.esv: 5 Thus says the Lord GOD to these bones: Behold, I will cause breath to enter you, and you shall live.
verses.kjv: 5 Thus saith the Lord GOD unto these bones; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live:
verses.niv: 5 This is what the Sovereign LORD says to these bones: I will make breath enter you, and you will come to life.

verses.esv: 19 On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the doors being locked where the disciples were for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.” 20 When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord. 21 Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, even so I am sending you.” 22 And when he had said this, he breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit. 23 If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you withhold forgiveness from any, it is withheld.”
verses.kjv: 19 Then the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you. 20 And when he had so said, he shewed unto them his hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord. 21 Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you. 22 And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost: 23 Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.
verses.niv: 19 On the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said, "Peace be with you!" 20 After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord. 21 Again Jesus said, "Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you." 22 And with that he breathed on them and said, "Receive the Holy Spirit. 23 If you forgive anyone his sins, they are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven."

verses.esv:
22   Stop regarding man
    in whose nostrils is breath,
    for of what account is he?
verses.kjv: 22 Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be accounted of?
verses.niv: 22 Stop trusting in man, who has but a breath in his nostrils. Of what account is he?

verses.esv:
29   When you hide your face, they are dismayed;
    when you take away their breath, they die
    and return to their dust.
30   When you send forth your Spirit, they are created,
    and you renew the face of the ground.
verses.kjv: 29 Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust. 30 Thou sendest forth thy spirit, they are created: and thou renewest the face of the earth.
verses.niv: 29 When you hide your face, they are terrified; when you take away their breath, they die and return to the dust. 30 When you send your Spirit, they are created, and you renew the face of the earth.

verses.esv:
7   The grass withers, the flower fades
    when the breath of the LORD blows on it;
    surely the people are grass.
verses.kjv: 7 The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: because the spirit of the LORD bloweth upon it: surely the people is grass.
verses.niv: 7 The grass withers and the flowers fall, because the breath of the LORD blows on them. Surely the people are grass.

verses.esv:
6   By the word of the LORD the heavens were made,
    and by the breath of his mouth all their host.
verses.kjv: 6 By the word of the LORD were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.
verses.niv: 6 By the word of the LORD were the heavens made, their starry host by the breath of his mouth.

verses.esv:
9   By the breath of God they perish,
    and by the blast of his anger they are consumed.
verses.kjv: 9 By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.
verses.niv: 9 At the breath of God they are destroyed; at the blast of his anger they perish.

verses.esv: 6 And I will lay sinews upon you, and will cause flesh to come upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you shall live, and you shall know that I am the LORD.”
verses.kjv: 6 And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.niv: 6 I will attach tendons to you and make flesh come upon you and cover you with skin; I will put breath in you, and you will come to life. Then you will know that I am the LORD.'"

verses.esv:
8   But it is the spirit in man,
    the breath of the Almighty, that makes him understand.
verses.kjv: 8 But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
verses.niv: 8 But it is the spirit in a man, the breath of the Almighty, that gives him understanding.

verses.esv:
15   Then the channels of the sea were seen,
    and the foundations of the world were laid bare
  at your rebuke, O LORD,
    at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
verses.kjv: 15 Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
verses.niv: 15 The valleys of the sea were exposed and the foundations of the earth laid bare at your rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of breath from your nostrils.

verses.esv: 11:1 Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
verses.kjv: 1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
verses.niv: 1 Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see.

verses.kjv: 1 Praise ye the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary: praise him in the firmament of his power. 2 Praise him for his mighty acts: praise him according to his excellent greatness. 3 Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp. 4 Praise him with the timbrel and dance: praise him with stringed instruments and organs. 5 Praise him upon the loud cymbals: praise him upon the high sounding cymbals. 6 Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. Praise ye the LORD.
verses.niv: 1 Praise the LORD. Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his mighty heavens. 2 Praise him for his acts of power; praise him for his surpassing greatness. 3 Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet, praise him with the harp and lyre, 4 praise him with tambourine and dancing, praise him with the strings and flute, 5 praise him with the clash of cymbals, praise him with resounding cymbals. 6 Let everything that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.

verses.esv: 9:1 But Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest
verses.kjv: 1 And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,
verses.niv: 1 Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord's disciples. He went to the high priest

verses.esv: 33 For a burning place has long been prepared; indeed, for the king it is made ready, its pyre made deep and wide, with fire and wood in abundance; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of sulfur, kindles it.
verses.kjv: 33 For Tophet is ordained of old; yea, for the king it is prepared; he hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.
verses.niv: 33 Topheth has long been prepared; it has been made ready for the king. Its fire pit has been made deep and wide, with an abundance of fire and wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of burning sulfur, sets it ablaze.

verses.esv:
10   In his hand is the life of every living thing
    and the breath of all mankind.
verses.kjv: 10 In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
verses.niv: 10 In his hand is the life of every creature and the breath of all mankind.
